data.text: Recent IMF research shows the policies and the amount of investment needed over the next 5-10 years to reach net zero emissions by 2050. Read more in our latest #IMFBlog #climate: https://t.co/APRak6aIW4 https://t.co/kYZPs4K7xe
Curbing the market power of large, powerful companies can indirectly support the recovery by making monetary policy more powerful. https://t.co/oe3NbJFAY5 #IMFBlog https://t.co/jNPhF4juIL

Inflation expectations are one of the key drivers of effective monetary policy but there is another, often overlooked driver. To find out more, read this #IMFBlog: https://t.co/oe3NbJFAY5 https://t.co/1vtMSoayB6

The public and private sectors will need to pursue around $6-10 trillion more in global investments over the next decade to mitigate #climate change. Read more in our latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/APRak6aIW4 https://t.co/mLOzeLSqqz

It is time to consider significant reforms to the way the #Olympics are pursued, prepared for, and hosted, argues Rob Baade of Lake Forest College and Victor Matheson of the College of the Holy Cross in a new #FandD article: https://t.co/F5KmkUZFia https://t.co/LjRyVVr6NB

In October 2020, The Bahamas leapfrogged into the digital vanguard with the launch of the world’s first central bank digital currency—the sand dollar. @GovernorCBOB and @KGeorgieva will discuss the future of money on July 29, at 8:30 AM ET. #IMFexchange https://t.co/K1SbrRnU4E

The pandemic hit informal workers particularly hard, especially women, pushing many into extreme poverty in 2020. Our new book looks at policies to support workers in the #InformalEconomy. https://t.co/RaHCEQJmgn https://t.co/tMrCcE57BD

Pushpam Kumar, Chief Environmental Economist @UNEP invites you to think out of the box on how to mainstream climate into economic analysis! Learn more & submit your idea at https://t.co/LCqq3ecWoc #IMFinnovation #climateaction https://t.co/SlGQLx9zkS

Join the #IMFexchange conversation between Governor of the Central Bank of The Bahamas John Rolle and IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva, moderated by @jchatterleyCNN, as they explore fundamental questions about the future of money. July 29, at 8:30 AM ET. https://t.co/Gvj0uXohho https://t.co/vD0uAd23uG

The #InformalEconomy is the only source of income and a critical safety net for millions of people worldwide. Bringing more individuals and firms into the formal sector requires a balanced approach. More in this new IMF book: https://t.co/RaHCEQJmgn https://t.co/LKJieEA3r8

Informal workers are part of every country's economy. On average, they contribute 35% of GDP in low- and middle-income countries versus 15% in advanced economies. More in the latest IMF book: https://t.co/3OwDs1NCGU #InformalEconomy https://t.co/tx2HIIUF0m

Is it time to consider permanent venues for the Olympics? @LFCollege’s Robert Baade & @holy_cross’ @VictorMatheson_ argue in #FandD that with the cost of hosting the #Olympics now routinely exceeding any reasonably expected returns, it is time for reforms. https://t.co/F5KmkVhgGK https://t.co/XDLvLQ5wSv

As the recovery proceeds, Georgia should ease the support measures put in place at the beginning of the pandemic to reduce its debt and deficit. Strengthening #education and vocational training would also help make its economy more inclusive. https://t.co/MOgOOv5pMq

The swift and decisive actions taken by #Georgia’s central bank @NBGeorgia during the pandemic, along with the measures it has implemented over the last few years, have contributed to a resilient financial sector. Click here to learn more: https://t.co/wYp44d82YW https://t.co/VIdExTcziP

🇬🇪 The pandemic took a heavy toll on #Georgia’s economy, and the government responded with substantial support for vulnerable people and businesses. https://t.co/sdJt1k7uac
